str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
A place, piece of land, field, property, estate. Diminutive of chora; a spot or plot of ground.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Publius, a governor of Malta. Of Latin origin; apparently 'popular'; Poplius, a Roman.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An island. Probably from the base of naus; an island.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To welcome, receive kindly; I undertake, assume the responsibility of. From ana and dechomai; to entertain.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I entertain a stranger, (b) I startle, bewilder. From xenos; to be a host; by implication, be strange.
Kindly, in a friendly manner. Adverb from philophron; with friendliness of mind, i.e. Kindly.
Three. Or neuter tria a primary number; 'three'.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
